choices.A: Install new RDS servers using Windows Server 2012 R2.
choices.D: Install View Agent on existing RDS Servers and select USB redirection to be included.
choices.B: Install View Client on user device with USB redirection feature enabled.

discussion.content:
2008R2 does not suport USB Redirection, you need RDS servers with Windows Server 2012 R2. Answer is A.
https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Horizon-7/7.1/com.vmware.horizon.virtual.desktops.doc/GUID-F8EE4473-FB6E-411A-BD30-EAB2EBE4DB5B.html

comments.content: The link says 2008 does not support USB redirection, But 2008 R2 does support it (but for single user desktop). here question is about the application

Referencing Wes's reference: "USB redirection is supported on Windows Server 2008 R2 and Windows Server 2012 R2 systems that are used as single-user desktops."

Still A.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Gives users access to locally connected USB storage devices.
Specifically, redirection of USB flash drives and hard disks is supported in published desktops and published applications. Redirection of other types of USB devices, and other types of USB storage devices such as security storage drives and USB CD-ROM, is not supported in published desktops and published applications.
This setup option is not selected by default. You must select the option to install it. This option is available on RDS hosts that run Windows Server 2012 or 2012 R2 but not Windows Server 2008 R2.

May be D "Install View Agent on existing RDS Servers and select USB redirection to be included"
When you run the Horizon Agent installation wizard on the remote desktop source or RDS host, be sure to include the USB Redirection component.
This component is deselected by default. You must select the component to install it.
https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Horizon-7/7.9/horizon-remote-desktop-features/GUID-C64A6CE8-F02A-4A05-A4CB-FB127A7465DE.html

questions.question_text:
A company has decided to implement RDS Application Pools. Its current server standard is Windows Server 2008 R2. The application requires access to a client
USB device.
What must be done to allow USB redirection for this setup?

choices.C: vRealize Operations for Horizon Desktop Agent
choices.E: vRealize Operations for Horizon Broker Agent
choices.D: vRealize Operations Manager remote collector nodes
choices.A: vRealize Operations Microsoft SQL Server plug in

discussion.content: B, E. vRops agent is part of the horizon agent so no need to install the separate agents on the master image. The broker agent and adapter are required though.
correct answer is B,C because you need to monitoring user experience and sessions PCoIP... Broker is used to monitor horizon infrastructure (Connection Servers).
Going with B,E. View agent is part of image.
imo that It's B,E because horizon Desktop agent is default.

in ExamCollection answer is : BC
i get confused

Looking into this question more it's CE because you need the Broker agent on a connection server for V4H and the vROPS desktop agent in the Master image so the VDI machines report their stats back to vROPS
Why would the SQL plugin meet the correct answer here when all it monitors is SQL metrics https://marketplace.vmware.com/vsx/solutions/microsoft-sql-solution-for-vrealize-operations-manager

questions.question_text:
A customer has chosen vRealize Operations Manager for Horizon as its monitoring solution.
The customer's requirements are:
✑ Monitor the PCoIP metrics to address user experience complaints.
✑ Minimum required resources should be used for monitoring purposes.
Recent project updates include:
✑ vRealize Operations Manager is already in use for vSphere monitoring.
✑ All desktop templates are created with Horizon 7 View agent and Horizon deployment is at the final stage of completion.
✑ Existing vRealize Operations Manager capacity is already scaled out to meet the current requirements of Horizon 7 monitoring needs.
Which two additional components are required to make the monitoring systems ready? (Choose two.)
Which are three default network ports that need to be allowed through a firewall for a Workspace One solution supporting Mobile Single-Sign on (SSO) for iOS and Android devices? (Choose three.)

discussion.content:
443 HTTPS 
88 UDP port to open for mobile SSO
5262 TCP Android mobile device

choices.A: vCenter server is configured to use the SQL database which was down.
choices.C: View Connection Server is configured to use the SQL database which was down.
choices.D: Composer server is configured to use the SQL database which was down.
choices.B: App Volumes Manager Server is configured to use the SQL database which was down.

questions.question_text:
During recent SQL server maintenance, an issue was reported where some users were unable to access some of their assigned applications within the VDI environment. All users report being able to still connect to their instant clone desktops.
Which condition might account for the outage?

discussion.content:
B "App Volumes Manager Server is configured to use the SQL database which was down."
Center Appliance using its own DB, View Connection is using DB only for events, Composer availability will not affect because Instant Clones are using in this question

CE 
Correct for me because of erasure coding : https://storagehub.vmware.com/t/vsan-space-efficiency-technologies/host-requirements-1/

comments.content: Agreed; the capacity requirements are below the minimally necessary host count to support erasure coding.

Agree with C and E
6-host cluster, FTT=2
4-host cluster, FTT=1

questions.question_text:
An architect is deploying Horizon 7.0 on vSAN 6.2. The architect wants to take advantage of the erasure coding feature to save disk space. Each host contains
4TB of capacity flash disk. The desktop base image has 2GB of RAM and a 40GB C: drive. The cluster must support 200 concurrent users.
Which two configurations satisfy requirements? (Choose two.)
